I have a few problems with windwall myself. Sure, the ability can be played around, but honestly this ability is too strong for being a basic ability.

First off, the ability grows in width to the point that it can block an entire {{champion:21}} ult and lasts .75 more seconds than {{champion:21}}'s ult. That is pretty ridiculous considering that is an ULT vs. a BASIC ability. For people that say bait the wind wall, I have heard it before.

 Secondly, the ability moves over 50 units during that timeframe. This part isn't strong, just a feature about it. 

Thirdly, the blocking part starts even before the ability is full formed and can grant sight to Yasuo and his team. 

I just feel that the wall should be reworked or nerfed. Either nerf the duration of the damn wall, the width, both, or add a new feature of a damage threshold that destroys the wall after X amount of damage that scales per level of the ability instead of allowing the wall to get bigger. 

Also, this ability  IS a problem. It is blocking most ranged abilities for 3.75 seconds. 3.75 seconds now-a-days is overkill considering that if your melee diver goes in, windwall get popped, your melee teammate is probably dead because they don't have the covering fire from the ranged characters because 1 second into the engage they get popped now it is a 4v5. (There are some ranged characters who have ways of getting around the windwall). Another thing, for the characters that don't move extremely fast or have dashes, this wall is hard to play around because of how big the wall can get.)
It's sad that I have to ban Yasuo instead of an ADC when I play Miss Fortune lmfao. He's basically a direct counter in another lane.

> [{quoted}](name=Raymønd Åmantius,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=yjd6TdJz,comment-id=001b00000000,timestamp=2018-09-09T23:56:08.200+0000)
>
> Yes, if you never bait out his windwall.

People keep saying this, but you never stop to think about it: how can you "bait" ww unless Yasuo misplays?

Let's say I'm MIss Fortune.
How do I bait his ww?

Do I auto him?
He WWs and jumps on me for a nice trade early because I walked too close to him; even if I can get an auto off when he runs back after the trade, I'll still probably just take his shield down while he chunked my hp.
Later in the game, he just kills me before the wall is down or shortly after.

Do I Q?
He doesn't need to WW that, he just needs to not stand directly behind dying minions (like any other champion in the game playing against Miss Fortune).

Do I W?
... does it really have to be explained why it would be a misplay to windwall that?

Do I E?
Ww doesn't affect E; also it doesn't really do damage unless it's maxed and/or it's AP Miss Fortune and/or has Comet.

Do I Ult?
Well yes, he'll 100% windwall this... except that's not "baiting" in any sense of the word, because I wouldn't have any significant follow up for that: if I'm close enough, he'll use the wall to cancel my ult and fight back, else he'll just stay back until it comes off cooldown (which is a very good price for wasting the enemy's ult).

TL;DR
You can't "bait" windwall unless he misplays or is terminally stupid.
Which, as pointed out in the comment https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/yjd6TdJz-remove-windwall?comment=0012000000000000 , is exactly Yasuo's problem: he loses because he played bad, not because his enemy played well.

he's one of the most frustrating champions in both the lane phase and the team fight phase, because everything revolves around him

his passive is a free shield that will block any poke used against him and blocks roughly 200 at level 6...  for free.  It throws a wrench into every gameplay pattern there is that's not melee, because you have to poke him with an auto attack first and wait out the duration, meanwhile, it doesn't even have a static cooldown while he can refresh it with just motion

at level 1, his passive blocks 100 damage and at level 6, the actual value is 220

as a result of such, he's also the only champion to receive a direct profit by walking in place back and forth

the duration of his shield may be small, but it's enough time that unless hit with direct crowd control (which only a handfull of champions would be able to accomplish easily), he would mess up their entire combo from this one instance while taking almost no damage and even then he knocks off over 200 while still in the laning phase...

200 is, well let's take syndra for an example.  He can block an ENTIRE ABILITY and an auto attack in that time frame.  Syndra is a poor choice given her ability to spam, but she is one of the most burst-heavy champs in the game

yasuo even has two options to him to interrupt her combo

if she misses her scatter the weak stun, he can use his ultimate to block the entirely of her ultimate.  He can also block scatter the weak with it but risk her ultimate

we can take a look at it, but these values also assume the yasuo gets no opportunity to attack the syndra

syndra can aim up to 3 Q's within her combo, 1 negated by default, an auto attack also negated if she's in range to do it but is within danger parameters for that

let's limit it to 1 Q

she then does 300 for the other Qs + AP ratio  70 for each of her other basic abilities for a total of 440 and then her ultimate with 6 spheres for a total of 1080

she can do up to 1520 in magic damage before runes, but again, this all assumes that yasuo does not counter her abilities with his windwall.  if we limit it to one sphere before his stun wears off, yasuo will take

situation where she hits her stun but he windwalls ult= 440 + 180 = 620 + AP ratios and runes and yasuo has 866 hp minimum  1520 damage reduced to 620 and that's if everything is perfect...

situation where he blocks her scatter the weak = 370 + up to 1080.  If he has his third stage Q, he can still end her damage


it all comes down to the yasuo, not the opposing player and he's one of the fastest late-game powerspikes in the game

Someone complaining about Yasuo's Windwall again... Nice! Have you ever tried to not use every single ability you have on the windwall when he uses it ?
I've seen many people just throwing every skill they have without even moving...

The issue is that it essentially disables other champions like brand, who rely on landing a skill shot for an extensive period of time.

Say I successfully E W you, cause I controlled the wave better, and was able to expend a cooldown like that, since I finally stopped the endless free no reource AoE shoving of yasuo.

Yas windwalls, I can't Q. my passive expires, now his wall is down I still have wave control though, cause I am a better player, doen't matter. I am still waiting on my E W to back up so i can proc my passive, and not just waste all my mana.

Yasuos E has now refreshed on me and the creeps and the next wave as arrived, I can't approach the wave, cause even though its level 4, he'll chop me up, just like he does at all stages, cause he scales (but sure, ok I am a mage, I should be able to deal). I now must instead Q the cannon, then E W to clear it. 

Now my cooldowns are off again, I have to abandon the wave because yasuo has neither resource nor relevant cooldowns. 

In all this time, his wall is back up, and we restart. Kepp in mind, my mana pool, even with maximum passive utalization, only allows me to realistically wrestle wave controll from him wevery other wave, or if I am smart about cannons. 

So, I get about 5 opportunities, assuming I am the better player, 4 of those times I beat him, even still the yas winwall requires me to risk my wave control and lane presence, to fish the EW against him, while his wall is down, as the second wave is arriving. I get a 2-3 second window to ever pressure him.

If I fuck up this window, Yasuo can turn on me with no cooldowns, and dash through the now arriving wave, which I must also conede because he chunks me there.

FInally, level 6 hits, and I am not a champion anymore, because his ult against me give so much more value than mine against his, again due to WW. A large portion of my strength is packed into my Passive, and my ult is strong because it gives me reliable passive procs when used in chokepoints. 

Yasuo essentially negates all the power in my kit, escapes all lane threat, and scales insanely, plus he can abuse conqueror, because his lane is so safe, and he gets away with using its power late game, with out paying the price of having such a fighting dependant keystone, that would result in most carries being too weak to fight in lane, unless they already had an upper hand.

Its not that Yasuo windwall blocks my damage, its that it chokes up an already narrow window in a lane against SO many champions when he doesn't even need it, given how strong his lane is by way of his passive, being resourceless, ad a spammable AoE with a 100% AD ratio, that lowers with both CDR and attack speed

This is the problem with Yasuo.

Yasuo ONLY loses if the Yasuo player messes up. Yasuo players know they can 1v5 outplay if they play perfectly, and thus go for very challenging plays. The only reason Yasuo isn't insanely busted in even low diamond elo is because most players have poor decision making on him. In Challenger and Pro Play, teams can handle him well with proper coordination - but that's not at all the same as the game that 99.999% of us are playing.

I should be able to beat yasuo by playing well myself. It shouldn't come down entirely to whether he misplays or bot.

"Bait his Windwall" - implies Yasuo was baited, he misplayed and used Windwall when he shouldn't have
"He needs to react fast" - implies Yasuo lost because he reacted too slow, Yasuo misplayed
"He's squishy if he gets CC'd" - implies he got hit by CC despite being insanely mobile and having an ability to block projectiles: i.e. Yasuo misplayed.

Yasuo only loses if he misplays badly. Yasuo can still make mistakes, or put himself in bad situations, and come out way ahead. He's way too hard to punish, and needs to really mess up to get punished in solo queue. Playing a bit better than him doesn't matter. 

e.g. in early laning phase he can windwall my CC skillshot easily and chunk me for 70% of my health when my CC ability is on cooldown. Then I can hit him with my CC ability because he messed up, and barely do 50% of his health before needing to back off (because he'll chunk me for 40%-50% while my CC ability is on cd [lower because I had the time with him cc'd] if I don't back off earlier). AND that's already assuming I've previously gotten rid of his passive shield with an auto attack before landing the CC, if not I'm barely doing 30% poke with a full combo that would normally chunk my lane opponent for 50-70% otherwise. 

Doesn't that seem wrong? He gets the full advantage, has full control over the outcome (whether he misplays or not), and yet when he doesn't mess up he gets rewarded larger than I get rewarded when he messes up? What's the point? 

Yasuo loses because he knows he has this advantage and thus gets too aggressive and dies to ganks, etc... Largely because Yasuo players (below high diamond) make poor decisions. NOT because Yasuo isn't rather strong...
